title: Technology-Enhanced Instructional Design for Improving Acceptance of Educational Social Robots

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A process where university students explore the educational applicability of social robots and analyze psychological/social factors influencing technology acceptance. Flexible learning environments are provided through mobile-based microlearning.

learning_goals: Analyze the impact of social interaction functions in educational social robots on learners' acceptance levels
Derive anticipated barriers to social robot adoption by applying the Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTAUT)
Empirically validate the correlation between ICT familiarity and robot acceptance through project-based assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
